intro: Acourtia alamanii, commonly known as the San Francisco dandelion, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leafy basal rosette. The plant typically grows in coastal scrub and grassland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Acourtia alamanii is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used by indigenous communities for its healing benefits.
